page.title: 02HOUSING
page.content:
Nearly all the houses in Basildon were built by the Development Corporation, and were rented by the occupiers. About five years ago, these rented houses were offered for sale to the tenants, and about a third of the tenants opted to buy their house. So today, it is a mixture or tenant and owner occupier. The more recent development has all been for owner occupier,and whereas the original houses were terraced and small, the houses being built around the edges of the town are now detatched and much larger. Some are selling for Â£100,000.
Within our 3x4 kilometres square, nearly alll the housing is in the west-most half. The other half is open countryside.
